alert.note: Alert for Boyd; Carter; Greenup (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 03 at 5:58AM EST by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Boyd, Greenup and northern Carter Counties through 630 AM EST... At 557 AM EST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Gesling, or 7 miles north of Carter Caves State Park, moving east at 55 mph. HAZARD...Winds up to 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Carter Caves State Park, Greenup, Load, Coalton, Gesling, Greenbo Lake, Oldtown, Naples, Carter, Wurtland, Hopewell, Brushart and Warnock. This includes Interstate 64 in Kentucky between mile markers 177 and 178. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
